abstract: A window dismissal action stored in a view’s environment.
overview:
## Discussion

Use the `dismissWindow` environment value to get an [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/DismissWindowAction] instance for a given [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/Environment]. Then call the instance to dismiss a window. You call the instance directly because it defines a [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/DismissWindowAction/callAsFunction(id:)] method that Swift calls when you call the instance.

For example, you can define a button that dismisses an auxiliary window:

If the window was opened with [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/EnvironmentValues/pushWindow], the presenting window will reappear when this action is performed.
